content.description: September’s Children is on one of the best and tallest boulders on the Front Range. Start in the middle of the corridor on the left side (looking upwards), and make technical moves up a beautiful and perfect seam on the orange streak of rock. Consistent movement leads to a two move crux at 30 feet revolving around a long lockoff two and from a left hand gaston. Continue through to the top on committing and technical terrain.
content.protection: A pad to keep your shoes clean before starting.
content.location: On the left wall of the Twin Towers, this is probably the most striking line on the boulders, and it climbs an extremely tall (read solo) seam with beautiful rock. It’s the seam in the middle of the wall.

content.description: Ghost Soldier is a classic face climb on the right tower of the Twins Towers. Start standing on a good block/rail, and climb up and slightly right on thin but perfect crimps which terminate at a sharp and small right hand crimp. Make a commuting deadpoint to a huge jug ledge at 20 feet, and top out, taking care of the detached block. This is a very, very good face climb with reasonable height.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot.
content.location: On the right (tower) side of Twin Towers, start on a high block/rail toward the right of the boulder inside the corridor. Follow a line up and left to a big move when it blanks out.
